intro: Leptonychia kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a complex thallus structure with a distinct leaf-like appearance and is characterized by its ability to retain water in arid conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
